text.p: Given the above scenario, let [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] be the standard matrix for [mathjaxinline]S[/mathjaxinline]. Recall that the [mathjaxinline]n\times n[/mathjaxinline] identity matrix [mathjaxinline]I_ n[/mathjaxinline] is the standard matrix for [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline]. Which of the following is true?

font.p: [mathjaxinline]AI_ n[/mathjaxinline] is the standard matrix for [mathjaxinline]S\circ T[/mathjaxinline] (from the above scenario) and from the previous question, we have [mathjaxinline]S\circ T=S[/mathjaxinline]. Thus, [mathjaxinline]AI_ n[/mathjaxinline] equals the standard matrix for [mathjaxinline]S[/mathjaxinline], which is [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline].

Since [mathjaxinline]I_ n[/mathjaxinline] has [mathjaxinline]n[/mathjaxinline] columns and [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] has [mathjaxinline]m[/mathjaxinline] rows, [mathjaxinline]I_ nA = A[/mathjaxinline] is undefined.
